sections.heading: Variable Names
sections.description: A variable can have a short name (like x and y) or a more descriptive name (age, carname, total_volume). Rules for Python variables:

sections.heading: Multi Words Variable Names
sections.description: Variable names with more than one word can be difficult to read. There are several techniques you can use to make them more readable:

sections.heading: Camel Case
sections.description: Each word, except the first, starts with a capital letter:

sections.heading: Pascal Case
sections.description: Each word starts with a capital letter:

sections.heading: Snake Case
sections.description: Each word is separated by an underscore character:
